# Morning Docket: 04.18.16
## * Later today, the Supreme Court will hear its "last great case of the Obama era" when arguments are presented in [U.S. v. Texas](http://www.scotusblog.com/case-files/cases/united-states-v-texas/), the biggest immigration case to come before the high court in a century. Given the current makeup of the Court, this case may be resolved with a 4-4 split, which would mean the president's deportation-relief plan will be blocked in Texas. [[Los Angeles Times](http://www.latimes.com/nation/immigration/la-na-court-obama-immigration-20160417-story.html)] * HBO's ["Confirmation,"](http://www.hbo.com/movies/confirmation) a film about the Anita Hill and Clarence Thomas Supreme Court hearings, was an excellent presentation of the media mob that ravenously feasted upon a law professor's sexual harassment allegations against America's most silent justice. The fact that our country is in the middle of yet another highly politicized battle over a SCOTUS confirmation only made this more enjoyable to watch. [[New York Times](http://www.nytimes.com/2016/04/14/arts/television/hbos-confirmation-revisits-anita-hill-clarence-thomas-and-drama-in-the-senate.html?_r=1&referer=http:/howappealing.abovethelaw.com/)] * Did Barnes & Thornberg help Avid Life Media defraud Ashley Madison subscribers? This is what plaintiffs allege in a consolidated lawsuit that's been filed against the extramarital affairs website, and they're seeking access to attorney-client privileged emails between the firm and the company to prove their case. [[Big Law Business](https://bol.bna.com/law-firm-emails-sought-in-ashley-madison-lawsuit/)] * A new partnership between Fresno City College, Fresno State, and San Joaquin College of Law will allow students to purchase a "one-way ticket to law school." That ticket won't be worth much after graduation, though, because San Joaquin Law's most recent bar passage rate for first-time takers was a [shockingly low 29 percent](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Joaquin_College_of_Law). [[Visalia Times-Delta](http://www.visaliatimesdelta.com/story/news/local/2016/04/15/fresno-state-offers-one-way-ticket-law-school/83109554/)] * Thanks to the popularity of hip-hopera [Hamilton](http://www.hamiltonbroadway.com/), Treasury Secretary Jack Lew has scrapped plans to replace Alexander Hamilton's face on the $10 bill with a woman's. Instead, it will be Andrew Jackson whose face is replaced with a woman's on the $20. Not to worry, Jackson fans -- the new bill won't be issued until around 2030. [[CNN](http://money.cnn.com/2016/04/16/news/economy/jack-lew-hamilton-10-bill/index.html?iid=hp-stack-dom)] * Bill Cosby's wife is scheduled to be deposed for the second time in a defamation suit filed by women who claim her husband called them liars after they came forward with sexual assault allegations against him. This time around, lawyers for the plaintiffs will be limited in that they'll be prohibited from asking her "improper questions." [[ABC News](http://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/wireStory/cosbys-wife-answer-questions-defamation-lawsuit-38463521)]
By [Staci Zaretsky](https://abovethelaw.com/author/staci-zaretsky/)  
onApril 18, 2016 at 8:59 AMApril 17, 2016 at 9:34 PM
0
Shares[](http://twitter.com/share?url=http://abovethelaw.com/2016/04/morning-docket-04-18-16/&text=Morning%20Docket:%2004.18.16)[](http://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=http://abovethelaw.com/2016/04/morning-docket-04-18-16/&display=popup&ref=plugin&src=share_button)[](http://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&url=http://abovethelaw.com/2016/04/morning-docket-04-18-16/)[](javascript:void("#ea-share-count-email"))

Kerry Washington as Anita Hill (Photo via HBO)

* Later today, the Supreme Court will hear its “last great case of the Obama era” when arguments are presented in [U.S. v. Texas](http://www.scotusblog.com/case-files/cases/united-states-v-texas/), the biggest immigration case to come before the high court in a century. Given the current makeup of the Court, this case may be resolved with a 4-4 split, which would mean the president’s deportation-relief plan will be blocked in Texas. [[Los Angeles Times](http://www.latimes.com/nation/immigration/la-na-court-obama-immigration-20160417-story.html)]

* HBO’s [“Confirmation,”](http://www.hbo.com/movies/confirmation) a film about the Anita Hill and Clarence Thomas Supreme Court hearings, was an excellent presentation of the media mob that ravenously feasted upon a law professor’s sexual harassment allegations against America’s most silent justice. The fact that our country is in the middle of yet another highly politicized battle over a SCOTUS confirmation only made this more enjoyable to watch. [[New York Times](http://www.nytimes.com/2016/04/14/arts/television/hbos-confirmation-revisits-anita-hill-clarence-thomas-and-drama-in-the-senate.html?_r=1&referer=http:/howappealing.abovethelaw.com/)]

[  ](https://bit.ly/3x7bHOy)
[Sponsored](https://bit.ly/3x7bHOy)
### [ Legal AI: 3 Steps Law Firms Should Take Now ](https://bit.ly/3x7bHOy)
If 2023 introduced legal professionals to generative AI, then 2024 will be when law firms start adapting to utilize it. Things are moving fast, so…
From [LexisNexis](https://bit.ly/3x7bHOy)  
* Did Barnes & Thornberg help Avid Life Media defraud Ashley Madison subscribers? This is what plaintiffs allege in a consolidated lawsuit that’s been filed against the extramarital affairs website, and they’re seeking access to attorney-client privileged emails between the firm and the company to prove their case. [[Big Law Business](https://bol.bna.com/law-firm-emails-sought-in-ashley-madison-lawsuit/)]


* A new partnership between Fresno City College, Fresno State, and San Joaquin College of Law will allow students to purchase a “one-way ticket to law school.” That ticket won’t be worth much after graduation, though, because San Joaquin Law’s most recent bar passage rate for first-time takers was a [shockingly low 29 percent](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Joaquin_College_of_Law). [[Visalia Times-Delta](http://www.visaliatimesdelta.com/story/news/local/2016/04/15/fresno-state-offers-one-way-ticket-law-school/83109554/)]

* Thanks to the popularity of hip-hopera [Hamilton](http://www.hamiltonbroadway.com/), Treasury Secretary Jack Lew has scrapped plans to replace Alexander Hamilton’s face on the $10 bill with a woman’s. Instead, it will be Andrew Jackson whose face is replaced with a woman’s on the $20. Not to worry, Jackson fans — the new bill won’t be issued until around 2030. [[CNN](http://money.cnn.com/2016/04/16/news/economy/jack-lew-hamilton-10-bill/index.html?iid=hp-stack-dom)]

# Biglaw Associate Introduces His Adorable Quintuplets To His Firm
## Congratulations!
By [Staci Zaretsky](https://abovethelaw.com/author/staci-zaretsky/)  
onMay 22, 2017 at 1:45 PMMay 28, 2017 at 9:05 AM
45
Shares[](http://twitter.com/share?url=http://abovethelaw.com/2017/05/biglaw-associate-introduces-his-adorable-quintuplets-to-his-firm/&text=Biglaw%20Associate%20Introduces%20His%20Adorable%20Quintuplets%20To%20His%20Firm)[](http://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=http://abovethelaw.com/2017/05/biglaw-associate-introduces-his-adorable-quintuplets-to-his-firm/&display=popup&ref=plugin&src=share_button)[](http://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&url=http://abovethelaw.com/2017/05/biglaw-associate-introduces-his-adorable-quintuplets-to-his-firm/)[](javascript:void("#ea-share-count-email"))

The Baudinet quintuplets (Photo via WTVR)

What could possibly be more stressful than being a Biglaw associate with a newborn? Being a Biglaw associate with five newborns.

Meet [Michael Baudinet](https://www.mcguirewoods.com/People/B/Michael-A-Baudinet.aspx#overview). He’s a 2012 graduate of Harvard Law School and an associate in the white-collar defense practice at McGuireWoods in Richmond, Virginia. He’s also the proud new father of quintuplets: Ava Louise, Clara Catherine, Camile Whitney, Isabelle Francis, and Luke Thomas. In case you were wondering, parents have about a one in 60 million chance of having quintuplets.

[  ](https://bit.ly/3x7bHOy)
[Sponsored](https://bit.ly/3x7bHOy)
### [ Legal AI: 3 Steps Law Firms Should Take Now ](https://bit.ly/3x7bHOy)
If 2023 introduced legal professionals to generative AI, then 2024 will be when law firms start adapting to utilize it. Things are moving fast, so…
From [LexisNexis](https://bit.ly/3x7bHOy)  
The Baudinet quints, who are now six months old, made their public debut last week in a large conference room at McGuireWoods, each wearing a tiny McGuireWoods onesie. “Getting up in the morning is hard because I don’t want to leave these guys, but then, you know, they got to get fed,” Michael said during an interview with local CBS affiliate [WTVR](http://wtvr.com/2017/05/16/four-girls-one-boy-goochland-quintuplets-make-their-debut/). “It’s pretty crazy, our quiet house has turned into a train station.” Here are some additional details from WTVR:

[Michael and Margaret Baudinet] had been trying to have children for more than 18 months and experienced miscarriages and other setbacks. That’s when they sought fertility treatment.

When word finally came that Margaret was pregnant, the doctors originally told the Baudinet’s they were having quadruplets. That was obviously incorrect.

“You know I was terrified. But at least I was able to talk, unlike this guy,” Margaret said pointing at Michael.

“I didn’t talk for about a month after finding out. Literally, a little bit of shock going on,” he said.

McGuireWoods offers new fathers six weeks of paid parental leave, and they may participate in a six-month “return-to-work ramp-up” where they will receive a 20 percent reduction in their billable-hour target with no change in their pay after returning from family leave.

Congratulations to Michael Baudinet on the birth of his quintuplets, and to McGuireWoods for being so supportive of its associate’s dive into parenthood.

# The Biglaw Firm Advising Ukraine On Sanctions
## The Biglaw firm is providing the services pro bono.
By [Kathryn Rubino](https://abovethelaw.com/author/krubino/)  
onMarch 30, 2022 at 4:03 PMMarch 30, 2022 at 3:44 PM
2
